snippet: Little is known about Lt. Gen. Zahir ul-Islam, the new head of Pakistan’s powerful Inter-Services Intelligence directorate, an agency vital to United States interests in the region.
abstract: Lt Gen Zahir ul-Islam, newly installed head of Pakistan's powerful Inter-Service Intelligence directorate, will make his first official visit to Washington; Gen Islam has maintained a conspicuously low profile since his appointment and little is known about his past; meeting comes during a low point in relations between Pakistani and American spies, following a series of contentious episodes.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from Islamabad, and Mark Mazzetti from Washington and Islamabad. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Salman Masood from Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Little is known about Lt. Gen. Zahir ul-Islam, the new head of Pakistan’s powerful Inter-Services Intelligence directorate, an agency vital to United States interests in the region.

headline.seo: Pakistan’s New ISI Chief Is an Enigma in the West
headline.main: Pakistan’s New Spy Chief Visits Washington at a Time of Frayed Relations
headline.print_headline: Pakistan’s New Spy Chief Visits Washington at a Time of Frayed Relations
